data.title: When Pakistan established its first Atomic Energy Commission? â€“ PakMcqs
data.text:
A. 1950

B. 1955

C. 1956

D. 1960

Submitted by: Altaf Hussain

Advertisement

In 1955, the government established a committee of scientists to prepare nuclear energy plans and build an industrial nuclear infrastructure throughout the country. As the Energy Council Act went into full effect, Prime minister Huseyn Suhrawardy established the Pakistan Atomic Energy Commission (PAEC) in March 1956.
